title: MozPod with Chima Mmeje - A Moz Podcast Series - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: MozPod with Chima Mmeje is unlike any SEO podcast you've ever listened to. Each episode offers practical tips to help you improve your SEO knowledge, land top-tier clients, and get the blueprint to supercharge your SEO career.
content: The Latest MozPod Episode Ep 18 | Building a £5 Million E-commerce Empire | Ash YoungAre you dreaming of launching your own e-commerce brand but unsure how to make it thrive? Join us for an exciting episode of MozPod as we dive into the incredible journey of Ash Young, who turned a simple idea into a thriving e-commerce business. Learn how Ash grew his car mat company from its first sale to a £5 million revenue powerhouse.In this episode, we explore:- The inspiration behind choosing car mats as a product- Unconventional tactics that fueled early growth- Overcoming competition in a crowded market- Crucial moments in scaling from £100k to £1 million and beyond- Risk management and adapting to rapid growth- The importance of customer feedback in shaping the business- Ash's advice for aspiring entrepreneurs, including when to invest in SEO Whether you're an e-commerce enthusiast, a budding entrepreneur, or simply curious about business growth strategies, this episode is packed with valuable insights and practical tips. Don't miss Ash's "hot take" on bringing SEO into the mix earlier and his candid reflection on what he'd do differently.Tune in to discover the highs, lows, and everything in between as we uncover the secrets behind building a successful e-commerce brand from scratch. Hit play now and get ready to be inspired!Catch up on the whole series on YouTube, Spotify, or Apple Podcasts. Discover the human stories at the heart of SEO and marketing. Chima Mmeje, takes you behind the scenes with the marketers, SEOs, and business owners. Sharing stories of resilience, innovation, and success, and a few missteps along the way. MozPod is about more than marketing strategies. With MozPod you will gain insights and inspiration directly from the experts, empowering you to navigate the ever-evolving landscape of SEO and marketing. Season 1: Ep 18 | Building a £5 Million E-commerce Empire | Ash Young available now YouTube | Spotify | Apple PodcastJoin us for an exciting episode of MozPod as we dive into the incredible journey of Ash Young, who turned a simple idea into a thriving e-commerce business. Learn how Ash grew his car mat eCommerce business from its first sale to a £5 million revenue powerhouse. Ep 17 | How to Become a Successful SEO Consultant | Luke Carthy available now YouTube, Spotify, or Apple PodcastsWhether you're just starting out or aiming to scale your business, Luke Carthy shares practical advice on building a sustainable consultancy while maintaining a work-life balance. Gain tips on personal branding and public speaking that can set you apart in the competitive SEO landscape. By the end of this episode, you'll have actionable ideas to help shape or improve your consulting career in SEO. Ep 16 | From Pub Meet up to SEO Powerhouse: Kelvin Newman on Building BrightonSEO available now YouTube, Spotify, or Apple PodcastsIn this episode of MozPod, Kelvin Newman, the founder of BrightonSEO, shares how he grew the event into the UK's largest SEO conference. If you're interested in the strategies behind growing large-scale events, this episode is a must-listen! Unlocking £1M Monthly E-commerce Revenue for a Brick and Mortar Brand available now YouTube | Spotify | Apple Podcast Have you ever wondered how to transform a brick and mortar in-store lead gen model into an e-commerce powerhouse? Join SEO strategist Katie Barnard and Digital PR expert Emma Carstairs as they reveal the secrets behind their success. Discover the PR and SEO strategies that fueled this incredible growth to achieve £1M monthly for this prestigious retail brand. Ep 14: What Ballroom Dancing Teaches You About SEO With James Miller available now YouTube | Spotify | Apple Podcast Can you balance your career and your passion? Is it possible to pursue dual careers and be successful at both? James Miller, Senior SEO Analyst and ballroom dance competitor and teacher, talks about the challenges and rewards. If you’re contemplating a dual career, this episode offers valuable insights on harmonizing different pursuits and achieving success in both. Ep 13: How to Scale Your Content Production With a Lean Team With Tom Bangay Available now YouTube | Spotify | Apple PodcastAre you looking to scale your content production tenfold without sacrificing quality or relying on freelancers? Tom Bangay, Senior Director of Content and Community at Juro, reveals how to achieve this and more. Learn how to drive revenue through organic traffic and create a winning keyword strategy with limited resources. Ep 12: How Exposure Ninja Grew Organic Revenue to £1.4M With Tim Cameron-Kitchen Available now YouTube | Spotify | Apple Podcast Getting big results with a small budget can feel impossible. Where do you even start when resources are tight, and expectations are high? In this episode, Tim Cameron-Kitchen, shares the strategies they used to create an organic traffic-driving strategy on a shoestring budget. Ep 11 | The Cheap Roast Dinner That Earned 100+ Backlinks With Amanda Walls Available now YouTube | Spotify | Apple Podcast Are you looking to earn quality backlinks? Join our host, Chima Mmeje, as she chats with Amanda Walls about how a supermarket roast dinner price comparison transformed into a link-building triumph. Ep 10 | The Dead NFT Campaign That Achieved Everything | James Hayward-Browne Available now YouTube | Spotify | Apple Podcast Join James Hayward-Browne, Marketing Director and co-founder of Bottled Imagination, and our host, Chima Mmeje, as we explore the strategies behind the Dead NFT PR campaign. Discover how James an his team turned a simple idea into a groundbreaking campaign that shook the crypto world. Ep 9: How Schema Markup Helped Tourism Australia Fool the World With Catherine Lux Available now YouTube | Spotify | Apple Podcast How Tourism Australia turned a $36 million Super Bowl ad into a viral marketing campaign by disguising it as a movie trailer. Join expert Catherine Lux as she reveals the SEO strategies and technical insights behind the ad’s success. This MozPod episode shows how SEO and high-impact advertising can work together to make a highly successful PR and marketing campaign. Ep 8: The Agency Blueprint: How to Scale From Five to Six-Figure Clients With Aaron Rudman-Hawkins Available Now YouTube | Spotify | Apple Podcast Aaron Rudman-Hawkins talks with our host, Chima Mmeje, about managing the risks of focusing on e-commerce clients, what he would have done differently, and how Evergreen strategically attracts new clients using creative content solutions. This episode is a must-listen for agency owners looking to understand managing the adjustment of specializing in a particular vertical. Ep 7: What I've Learned from Implementing a 4-Day Workweek at Literal Humans With Paul David Available now YouTube | Spotify | Apple Podcast In this episode, Chima Mmeje is joined by Paul David, CEO of Literal Humans to discuss how moving his company to a four-day workweek improved productivity and positively impacted the bottom line. This episode is perfect for agency owners and founders curious about how a shorter workweek can transform their business. Ep 6: A Marketer's Guide to Scaling a Startup to £1m MRR With Rod Richmond Available now YouTube | Spotify | Apple Podcast In this episode, Chima Mmeje is joined by startup CMO and founder, Rod Richmond to discuss his experience scaling an EV startup to £1m monthly recurring revenue and the pivotal role marketing played. This episode is invaluable for founders and growth marketers eager to learn actionable tactics for startup success, particularly through a marketing lens. Ep 5: Black Boy Joy: From £7/ hour to 7 Figures a Year With Joshua George Available now YouTube | Spotify | Apple Podcast In this episode, Chima Mmeje is joined by ClickSlice's founder, Joshua George to discuss his inspiring journey from signing his first agency client to scaling his business to 7 figures during the pandemic. This episode is a must-listen for anyone trying to scale an agency and achieve extraordinary success. Ep 4: What Can Ice Skating Teach You About Customer Acquisition? With Giulia Panozzo Available now YouTube | Spotify | Apple Podcast In this episode, Chima Mmeje is joined by neuromarketer and ice skater, Giulia Panozzo, to discuss her intriguing journey from psychobiology to SEO and how ice skating complements her marketing skills. This episode is great for those curious about neuromarketing, or anyone looking to start a dual career. Ep 3: Power Suits & Potty Breaks: Navigating Motherhood as a Marketing Leader With Miracle Inameti-Archibong and Donna Gleize Available now YouTube | Spotify | Apple Podcast In this episode, Chima Mmeje is joined by Miracle Inameti-Archibong and Donna Gleize to discuss balancing motherhood with a demanding career. They share their daily routine as moms and marketing leaders, the hurdles of returning to work after maternity leave, and a few laugh-out-loud stories involving their children. This conversation offers insights and encouragement for working mothers looking to navigate their dual roles effectively. Ep 2: No Nursery Rhymes Here: The Child-Free Route to Career Success With Myriam Jessier and Kari DePhillips Available now YouTube | Spotify | Apple Podcast Content Warning: This episode discusses sensitive topics such as sexual assault, workplace harassment, pregnancy, childbirth, and adoption. Viewer discretion is advised. This week on the MozPod with Chima Mmeje we're joined by Myriam Jessier and Kari DePhillips. Both open champions of the child-free lifestyle, Myriam and Kari share their personal stories on living a child-free life. Tune in to learn about their experiences with sexual harassment in the workplace, the decision to be child-free, and the different responses people have about their choices. Ep 1: Why we need safe spaces in male-dominated industries With Areej Abuli Available now YouTube | Spotify | Apple Podcast In this inaugural episode, Chima Mmeje is joined by Areej Abuli to discuss why safe spaces matter for women in tech SEO. This conversation provides valuable lessons and perspectives for those thinking of building a community and for founders who want to foster a more inclusive workplace. Be the first to know when episodes are available:
